page.title: 01BALCOMBE
page.content:
Development of Balcombe village centre survey undertaken by the children of Balcombe C.E. Primary,with the help of parents and members of the W.I.
Balcombe village developed along the Cuckfield,London Rd where it branches towards Ardingly and Haywards Heath.It is also on the London_Brighton main line railway,opened in 1841.The housing survey showed the growth of the village after the railway opened,and after 1939_1945 war,when it became a popular place for commuters working in London,Brighton,and the Gatwick/Crawley area. The two main roads show a considerable amount of infilling,which is still going on with three large new houses being built in the heart of the village this year. {(see page2)
